text:
_Minor_: I tried to login with Google and got “User not found”. Ok, have to sign up first, and then it works, however it feels like an unnecessary step. :man-shrugging: .
Hm… also find it strange, that if I choose to sign up with Google I would still need to specify a password.

elements.text: : I tried to login with Google and got “User not found”. Ok, have to sign up first, and then it works, however it feels like an unnecessary step.

.
Hm… also find it strange, that if I choose to sign up with Google I would still need to specify a password.

text: _Minor:_ the confirmation email looks a bit like a phishing attempt. :slightly_smiling_face:

elements.text: the confirmation email looks a bit like a phishing attempt.

text:
Hi Tomi,

Yes, we're aware of that confusion and will address it. We plan to blend signin/signup to make sign in/up with google inuitive.

>  Hm… also find it strange, that if I choose to sign up with Google I would still need to specify a password. (edited)
You can use either passkey or password, it is actually to derive a key to encrypted your private key, that store in the indexdb.

Think of it like the password that we use in Metamask/Rabby but not a password to sign-in o your account


>  _Minor:_ the confirmation email looks a bit like a phishing attempt. :slightly_smiling_face:
Well noted :slightly_smiling_face:. We will address.

elements.text:
Hi Tomi,

Yes, we're aware of that confusion and will address it. We plan to blend signin/signup to make sign in/up with google inuitive.
Hm… also find it strange, that if I choose to sign up with Google I would still need to specify a password. (edited)

You can use either passkey or password, it is actually to derive a key to encrypted your private key, that store in the indexdb.

Think of it like the password that we use in Metamask/Rabby but not a password to sign-in o your account
the confirmation email looks a bit like a phishing attempt.

text:
Congrats 5N Team ~:100:~
Playing around the wallet and here are some findings :
1, I register in mobile and when log on desktop, it comes up with "no stored keys for this account" ;
2,transfer some dev net token , the transaction cost of 100 cc is 2,2 cc and 10000 is 29.2 cc .
3, the balance showed up quickly but the transaction history has no data yet.

elements.text:
~
Playing around the wallet and here are some findings :
1, I register in mobile and when log on desktop, it comes up with "no stored keys for this account" ;
2,transfer some dev net token , the transaction cost of 100 cc is 2,2 cc and 10000 is 29.2 cc .
3, the balance showed up quickly but the transaction history has no data yet.

text:
Hi <@U08SFB458Q5>

1. We will provide option to sync key soon. For now, you will need to manually import it into the desktop browser unfortunately
2 and 3: We're having issue with showing history when the sender isn't an external party power by our wallet. We will improve in a future version. Right now the history is only when the initiator is a party powered by our wallet.

elements.text: We will provide option to sync key soon. For now, you will need to manually import it into the desktop browser unfortunately

2 and 3: We're having issue with showing history when the sender isn't an external party power by our wallet. We will improve in a future version. Right now the history is only when the initiator is a party powered by our wallet.

text:
yeah <@U08987JD1J9> , Great great job ~~
 i manually imported the private keys into desktop , want to know where is the key stored ?
Probably I should distribute some devnet token to let more ppl to join and test ?

elements.text:
, Great great job ~~
 i manually imported the private keys into desktop , want to know where is the key stored ?
Probably I should distribute some devnet token to let more ppl to join and test ?

text: The key is stored in your IndexDB in browser encrypted at rest(open the browser console > Application > Storage > IndexedDB > 5N_Wallet > wallet_store). The key to decrypted it is derive from either your password or webauthn(when using passkey). In a future version we may consider an option to allow you to this into icloud, window hello to sync across device for this encrypted key

elements.text: The key is stored in your IndexDB in browser encrypted at rest(open the browser console > Application > Storage > IndexedDB > 5N_Wallet > wallet_store). The key to decrypted it is derive from either your password or webauthn(when using passkey). In a future version we may consider an option to allow you to this into icloud, window hello to sync across device for this encrypted key

text: Excellent

>  Probably I should distribute some devnet token to let more ppl to join and test ?
yes please. Appreciate your support :slightly_smiling_face:

text:
Would appreciate if possible to create a party that doesn't use my email on signup / make that clearer in the process. Also to be able to add parties to my wallet once live.

Any plans to connect with CNS and be able to integrate that with the Address Book?

elements.text:
Would appreciate if possible to create a party that doesn't use my email on signup / make that clearer in the process. Also to be able to add parties to my wallet once live.

Any plans to connect with CNS and be able to integrate that with the Address Book?

text: Similarly, any plans to create public trust connections between CNS / PartyIDs ? like OG PGP days where i sign another name and set a trust level?

Both of anonymize party hint to not use email and  cns integration are on our pipeline.

>  Also to be able to add parties to my wallet once live.
> ny plans to create public trust connections between CNS / PartyIDs ? like OG PGP days where i sign another name and set a trust level?
Haven't though of this but see no reason we won't do it. Will let Yiannis chime in

text:
:rocket: *Introducing the Coin Metrics Canton Intelligence App* :mag:

Now available for participants in the *Canton ecosystem*!
Whether you’re a:
 :white_check_mark: *Super Validator* or *Validator* looking to analyze rewards and incentives
 :white_check_mark: *Application* earning tokens and needing transparency into token distribution
 :white_check_mark: *Custodian* tracking client activity and holdings at the account level
…the *Canton Intelligence App* is your all-in-one toolkit for unlocking on-chain intelligence.

:brain: *What You’ll Get:*
• *<https://docs.coinmetrics.io/network-data/atlas-overview|ATLAS>* — Balance-updated views of every Canton coin movement
• *<https://docs.coinmetrics.io/network-data/network-data-overview|NDP Metrics>* —  150+ metrics on supply, issuance, transaction value, address-level activity & more
• *<https://docs.coinmetrics.io/api/v4/|Full API Access>* —  Query data programmatically for deeper analysis
• *<https://atlas.coinmetrics.io/|Atlas UI>* and *<https://charts.coinmetrics.io/crypto-data/|Charting Tool>* — Easy to access UI tools for visualizing the data
:mag: *See what’s covered*:
 <https://coverage.coinmetrics.io/assets-v2/cc>
 <https://docs.coinmetrics.io/network-data/atlas-overview>

:bar_chart: *See the data in action*:
<https://coinmetrics.substack.com/p/state-of-the-network-issue-321>

:briefcase: *Pricing*: $400/month (paid in Canton via the Digital Asset Utility App)

:date: *Want a quick demo or ready to onboard?* Reach out and we’ll get you set up!
